title: The Killings at Badger's Drift
description: An elderly woman is found dead in her cottage and DCI Barnaby is convinced the death is not down to natural causes.

title: Written in Blood
description: After a noted author speaks before a group of local Midsomer writers, the naked body of the event's host is found bludgeoned to death in his bedroom.

title: Death of a Hollow Man
description: Barnaby donates time to the local amateur when Joyce is cast in a revival of "Amadeus," but complications arise when the leading man is murdered onstage.

title: Faithful unto Death
description: When the wife of a wealthy local businessman disappears, Barnaby finds that Fawcett Green harbors a complex web of financial and romantic entanglements.

title: Death in Disguise
description: DCI Barnaby needs all his wits about him as he investigates a string of deaths at a local New Age commune.

title: Death's Shadow
description: Barnaby and his wife plan to renew their wedding vows for their 25th anniversary, but he is distracted by the investigation of a brutal murder committed with an Indian sword.

title: Strangler's Wood
description: The nude body of a Brazilian woman is found strangled in the woods, which suggests that a serial killer from nine years before has begun killing again.

title: Dead Man's Eleven
description: Fletchers Cross is preparing itself for their annual cricket match against neighboring village, Midsomer Worthy. Troy has also been selected to open the batting for the Midsomer team. However, tragedy strikes when the wife of local landowner and cricket captain, Robert Cavendish, is discovered murdered after taking their dog for a walk.

title: Blood Will Out
description: The murder of a village blow-hard, who had few supporters among his neighbors, happens while a gathering of travelers is taking place.

title: Death of a Stranger
description: Fox hunting, taxidermy and Oscar Wilde are part of the backdrop as Barnaby and Troy investigate a series of murders, beginning with that of a tramp in the woods.

title: Blue Herrings
description: A visit to his convalescent aunt prompts Barnaby to investigate a series of suspicious deaths at the nursing home where she is staying.

title: Judgement Day
description: The residents of Midsomer Mallow fear for their chances in the Perfect Village competition when a local thief and womanizer is brutally killed with a pitchfork.

title: Beyond the Grave
description: Barnaby and Troy, with an actor tagging along for research, investigate a slashed painting at a museum, which later turns out to be the site of a murder.

title: Garden of Death
description: When an arrogant aristocratic family's decision to develop a memorial garden into a commercial tea shop has the villagers up in arms, murders past and present rear their heads.

title: Destroying Angel
description: After the severed hand of an heir to a scenic rural hotel and pub is found in the woods, the other heirs receive death threats from an unknown source.

title: The Electric Vendetta
description: The body of a criminal is found in a crop circle, the locals blame Extra-Terrestrail activity for the death. Barnaby is not convinced by the theories. A second criminal is found dead in similar circumstances.

title: Who Killed Cock Robin?
description: Barnaby and Troy are drawn to Newton Magna where their search for a horse whisperer allegedly struck by a car is complicated by the discovery of a body in the town well.

title: Dark Autumn
description: The near decapitation of the local postman, whose hyperactive libido also makes him the village lothario, leads to a series of grisly murders involving other promiscuous villagers.

title: Tainted Fruit
description: When the body of arrogant local beauty Melissa Townsend is discovered by the pool at her manor house, Barnaby and Troy uncover a seedy world of adultery and deceit within the affluent rural community.

title: Market for Murder
description: An investigation of a car fire and a bludgeon murder lead Barnaby and Troy to investigate the members of a local reading club which has an agenda that goes beyond books.

title: A Worm in the Bud
description: A woman is found dead in Setwale Wood, an apparent suicide, except that her suicide note is emailed after her body has already been sighted.

title: Ring Out Your Dead
description: In the village of Midsomer Wellow, someone is killing off the bell ringers of the parish church, in the week before a big bell-ringing competition. One young woman on the team is even shot dead in the churchyard on her wedding day.

title: Murder on St. Malley's Day
description: Barnaby investigates the murder of a boy during a traditional annual race at an exclusive private school but meets with resentment.

title: A Talent for Life
description: Something is fishy about the clubbing deaths of two local residents.

title: Death and Dreams
description: The investigation into an elaborate suicide leads Barnaby to suspect the dead man may have had help pulling the trigger.

title: Painted in Blood
description: Barnaby's wife, Joyce, finds a dead body on the Midsomer Florey village green while taking part in a watercolour painting class, and she recognizes it as the elderly Miss Fairfax.

title: A Tale of Two Hamlets
description: When heirs of the aristocratic Smythe-Webster family are killed, one by explosion and another by electrocution, Barnaby's investigation uncovers long-hidden family secrets.

title: Birds of Prey
description: Investment in a secret invention leads to an apparent suicide in Midsomer Magna, and a plan to steal valuable falcon eggs leads to another death.

title: The Green Man
description: Barnaby and Troy tackle two separate cases as Troy prepares to leave Midsomer after his promotion to DI.

title: Bad Tidings
description: Barnaby's new Sergeant arrives on the day after the murder of a local shrew occurs, and he is immediately put to work.

title: The Fisher King
description: Long-suppressed family secrets, stolen ancient artifacts, and a thirty year old death at a Celtic burial site result in a series of murders in present day Midsomer.

title: Sins of Commission
description: When Midsomer hosts its 12th Annual Literary Festival, an author is found with his neck broken. More writers will die before the winner of the competition is announced.

title: The Maid in Splendour
description: Midsomer Worthy's beloved local pub figures in a case involving unrequited love, secret business deals, and passionate affairs.

title: The Straw Woman
description: Midsomer comes closer and closer to its boiling point when a priest is burned to death inside the effigy of a straw woman and more people burst into flames spontaneously as though by witchcraft.

title: Ghosts of Christmas Past
description: Exactly nine years after Ferdy Villers killed himself, his entire family reunites for Christmas unaware that someone is out for revenge.

title: Things That Go Bump in the Night
description: Undertaker Patrick Pennyman is found dead with his wrists slashed and suspicion turns towards a spiritualist church.

title: Dead in the Water
description: During a regatta, the body of Rowing Club chairman Guy Sweetman is found bludgeoned and drowned. Bachelor Sweetman was prolifically promiscuous and jealousy would seem to be the motive.

title: Orchis Fatalis
description: Barnaby and Scott follow a trail of dead people involved in the collecting of rare orchids.

title: Bantling Boy
description: A four-member syndicate owns a racehorse that two of them are desperate to sell and two of them are determined to keep. When one of them is murdered, Barnaby is on the case.

title: Second Sight
description: John Ransom collapses and dies outside a pub after a fight with his brother-in-law over the baptism of his niece. He has electrical scars across the top of his head.

title: Hidden Depths
description: Troubled solicitor Nick Turner falls from the roof of his home, is this suicide disguised as murder?

title: Sauce for the Goose
description: When a corporate giant tries to acquire a small but respected relish factory owned and run by a dysfunctional family, a naked body is found in the warehouse.

title: Midsomer Rhapsody
description: Deaths follow the discovery of a valuable musical manuscript sold cheaply at an auction.

title: The House in the Woods
description: A secluded old dark house, believed haunted by the residents of Midsomer Newton, becomes the scene of a double murder when a househunting yuppie couple is found garroted.

title: Dead Letters
description: Barnaby and Jones investigate a series of murders linked to the death of a beauty queen which occurred several years previously.

title: Vixen's Run
description: Sir Freddy Butler collapses during a speech. The PM suggests the death is due to natural causes, however Barnaby is not convinced. Sir Freddy's will is stolen and his lawyer's house is burned down in an arson attack.

title: Down Among the Dead Men
description: Expert blackmailer Martin Barret is murdered and there is no shortage of suspects.

title: Four Funerals and a Wedding
description: A 90-year-old battle of the sexes comes to a head in Midsomer Broughton, with casualties on both sides.

title: Country Matters
description: Controversy about a proposed supermarket ruining the quality of life in a small village, marital infidelity, contaminated soil, and kinky sex lead to murder

title: Death in Chorus
description: A heated competition among Midsomer church choirs is interrupted by the bludgeon murder of the Midsomer Worthy's tenor, a local artist.

title: Last Year's Model
description: Barnaby begins to think the damning evidence he helped provide to convict a murderess wasn't exactly as watertight as it first looked.

title: Dance with the Dead
description: A young man's murder touches off a search for his girlfriend and partner in ballroom dancing classes.

title: The Animal Within
description: Faith's unannounced visit to her wealthy Uncle Rex's estate turns into quite a surprise. When Rex's body turns up, his would-be heirs engage in a battle of wills that exposes plenty of motives for murder.

title: King's Crystal
description: When King's family enterprise shatters into pieces and its accountant winds up stabbed, Barnaby digs into rivalries of business and blood-while Jones explores secret Masonic rites.

title: The Axeman Cometh
description: Badger's Drift plays host to the Midsomer Rock Festival - with murderous consequences.

title: Death and Dust
description: Barnaby and Jones are called to investigate a series of murders involving a pair of feuding families.

title: Picture of Innocence
description: Someone puts Barnaby in the frame in the murders of two rival photographers and is ordered to stay home on virtual house arrest.

title: They Seek Him Here
description: A film about the French Revolution is made in Midsomer. People lose their head in the guillotine, and it's not a film trick.

title: Death in a Chocolate Box
description: Barnaby investigates a murder of a former friend and colleague in Midsomer Holm, a small village inhabited by reformed ex-cons.

title: Shot at Dawn
description: A 90 years long feud between two families, the Hicks and the Hammonds, appears to have escalated to murder.

title: Blood Wedding
description: Barnaby has to deal with a murder at the wedding reception for a local aristocratic family as well as daughter Cully's upcoming nuptials.

title: Left for Dead
description: Jones is brought back to his home town to help investigate a series of murders linked to childhood friends and events that occurred years earlier.

title: Midsomer Life
description: When a man who's been missing for two weeks is found dead in the woods near Midsomer, Barnaby finds connections between him and a magazine editor known for his killing reviews of local hotels and restaurants.

title: The Magician's Nephew
description: The traditions of a local cult in Midsomer, the Temple of Thoth, appear to be related to a series of murders using poison of the poison dart frog.

title: Days of Misrule
description: During the Christmas days Barnaby has to solve an explosion as well as a number of murders near a freight company while trying to cope with his acting CS who has very strong beliefs about teamwork.

title: Talking to the Dead
description: Barnaby finds connections between a supposedly haunted forest, the traceless disappearances of two couples and a gang of antiquity thieves.

title: The Dogleg Murders
description: On the Midsomer Golfclub Whiteoaks a member is killed with a golfclub. In the course of the investigation they discover Whiteoaks to be full of hatred, gambling, violence, jealousy and extortion.

title: The Black Book
description: The sale of a previously unknown painting by an 18th century painter sends Barnaby into an investigation of murders as well as art forgery.

title: Secrets and Spies
description: A number of murders near a government safe house in Midsomer appears to be connected to a group of British spies stationed in East Berlin during the Cold War.

title: The Glitch
description: An air traffic computer system, based on theories from an eccentric college professor, is denounced by the scientist creating a financial crisis for its backers.

title: Small Mercies
description: The body of a local troublemaker and lady's man is found dead in the model village which is the chief tourist attraction of Little Worthy.

title: The Creeper
description: A cat burglar named "The Creeper" is breaking into the estates of Causton, and an alcoholic writer threatening a "tell-all" book about his friends turns up dead.

title: The Great and the Good
description: A troubled schoolteacher subject to sleepwalking and quasi-paranoia feels that an intruder has been in her house, and doubters find dead bodies to confirm her fears.

title: The Sword of Guillaume
description: When the Causton Chamber of Commerce takes a bus trip to Brighton, a serial killer swinging an ancient sword decapitates some of them in the seaside resort.

title: The Made-to-Measure Murders
description: A tailor dies of a heart attack. Two years later, his widow is murdered on her way to the vicarage. The vicar is murdered the same evening he receives a mysterious (unsigned) letter about love and sexual affairs.

title: Blood on the Saddle
description: A Wild West show comes to Ford Florey and a serial killer starts to eliminate villagers in a "wild west" fashion related to a parcel of disputed swamp land.

title: The Silent Land
description: Jeff Bowmaker runs a profitable business in Midsomer Magna conducting spooky "ghost tours" at night when the unpopular village librarian turns up dead.

title: Master Class
description: A gifted young pianist with emotional issues is in competition with other young talents for a scholarship in a prestigious private musical academy.

title: The Noble Art
description: When a famous 1860 bareknuckle boxing bout is restaged in Midsomer Morchard with great pomp, dead bodies begin to pile up for Barnaby.

title: Not in My Back Yard
description: A group of conservationists object to the development of a pristine part of the village and adherents from both sides become victims of a mysterious killer.

title: Fit for Murder
description: Joyce talks Barnaby into enrolling in a spa located in a remodeled manor house but the bodies start to pile up when he's there.

title: Death in the Slow Lane
description: When a local DJ is crushed to death at a traditional girls' boarding school, DCI John Barnaby discovers that murder and deception are never far away from the quaint villages.

title: Dark Secrets
description: The reclusive lives of an elderly eccentric couple come under police scrutiny when a social services investigator is murdered.

title: Echoes of the Dead
description: The drowning of a woman in a bathtub becomes the first murder in a series of copycat murders imitating infamous murders from the past.

title: The Oblong Murders
description: Barnaby sends Jones undercover into a New Age cult to investigate the disappearance of a young woman who entered an introduction course and then never left the movement.

title: The Sleeper Under the Hill
description: The gruesome discovery of a farmer's eviscerated body in an ancient stone circle is made just days before the spring equinox.

title: The Night of the Stag
description: Local bootleggers come under suspicion after the disappearance of a government inspector.

title: A Sacred Trust
description: Vandalism and violence send shock waves through Midsomer's cloistered nunnery.

title: A Rare Bird
description: Barnaby and Jones investigate whether competition between ornithology enthusiasts led to murder.

title: The Dark Rider
description: The DeQuettevilles and the Fleetwoods have been enemies since the English Civil War. Now the DeQuettevilles are dying, each first seeing a headless horseman. Is the ancient feud to blame? Or is there a modern murderer at large?

title: Murder of Innocence
description: When a barrister is killed in Midsomer, suspicion falls on convicted murderer Grady Felton. But Grady has a solid alibi. Barnaby suspects he is working with an accomplice - until Grady himself is targeted in an arson attack.

title: Written in the Stars
description: During a total eclipse of the sun, an astronomer is bludgeoned to death by a meteor, and an astrologer claims to have predicted each subsequent murder.

title: Death and the Divas
description: A film historian writing about a 1960s horror actress is killed in her home. It becomes the start of what appear to be a series of copycat murders based on the actress' films.

title: The Sicilian Defence
description: When a young girl wakes up from a mysterious coma, she finds that no one knows what happened to her boyfriend, who mysteriously disappeared around the same time she was attacked.

title: Schooled in Murder
description: At the factory where the world-famous Midsomer Blue Cheese is made, a dairy worker is brutally murdered by a giant round of weaponized cheese.

title: The Christmas Haunting
description: DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson investigate the fatal stabbing of a man with an antique sword during a ghost-hunting party at a 'haunted' manor house.

title: Let Us Prey
description: A series of murders in Midsomer St Claire seem to be inspired by macabre images on a medieval fresco recently discovered in the church crypt.

title: Wild Harvest
description: When the landlord of Wyvern House meets a brutal and untimely death in his own woods, many aspersions are cast.

title: The Flying Club
description: The owner of Finchmere airfield is dropped from a plane to meet a gruesome death. Are anti-craft campaigner's behind Bernard King's murder or does it link back to a World War Two mission?

title: The Killings of Copenhagen
description: Barnaby and Nelson join forces with two female Danish police detectives after Eric Calder is poisoned by Strychnine coating when opening one of his famous golden clusters.
